blocks.name: df-rels
blocks.content: Define the relations class. Proper class relations (like ` _I ` , see ~ reli ) are not elements of it. The element of this class and the relation predicate are the same when ` R ` is a set (see ~ elrelsrel ). The class of relations is a great tool we can use when we define classes of different relations as nullary class constants as required by the 2. point in our Guidelines ~ http://us.metamath.org/mpeuni/mathbox.html . When we want to define a specific class of relations as a nullary class constant, the appropriate method is the following: 1. We define the specific nullary class constant for general sets (see e.g. ~ df-refs ), then 2. we get the required class of relations by the intersection of the class of general sets above with the class of relations ~ df-rels (see ~ df-refrels and the resulting ~ dfrefrels2 and ~ dfrefrels3 ). 3. Finally, in order to be able to work with proper classes (like ~ iprc ) as well, we define the predicate of the relation (see ~ df-refrel ) so that it is true for the relevant proper classes (see ~ refrelid ), and that the element of the class of the required relations (e.g. ~ elrefrels3 ) and this predicate are the same in case of sets (see ~ elrefrelsrel ). (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 13-Jun-2018.)

blocks.name: elrels2
blocks.content: The element of the relations class ( ~ df-rels ) and the relation predicate ( ~ df-rel ) are the same when ` R ` is a set. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 14-Jun-2018.)

blocks.name: elrelscnveq3
blocks.content: Two ways of saying a relation is symmetric. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 22-Aug-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm elrelscnveq3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, crels), wb(wceq(c0, ccnv(c0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl5bb(wcel(c0, crels), wceq(c0, ccnv(c0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wa(wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wss(ccnv(c0), c0)))
  eqss(c0, ccnv(c0))
  impbid(wcel(c0, crels), wa(wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wss(ccnv(c0), c0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  com12(wcel(c0, crels), wa(wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wss(ccnv(c0), c0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  adantl(wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wi(wcel(c0, crels), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))))
  a1d(wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wcel(c0, crels), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  biimpi(wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  jca2(wcel(c0, crels), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wss(ccnv(c0), c0))
  syl5com(wcel(c0, crels), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wceq(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c0))
  sylib(wcel(c0, crels), wceq(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c0), wrel(c0))
  elrelsrelim(c0)
  dfrel2(c0)
  sylbir(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wi(wceq(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c0), wss(c0, ccnv(c0))), wss(ccnv(c0), c0))
  syl5ibcom(wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wceq(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c0), wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wss(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), ccnv(c0)))
  cnvss(ccnv(c0), c0)
  sseq1(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c0, ccnv(c0))
  biimpri(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wss(ccnv(c0), c0))
  cnvsym(s0, s1, c0)
}

blocks.name: elrelscnveq2
blocks.content: Two ways of saying a relation is symmetric. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 22-Aug-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm elrelscnveq2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, crels), wb(wceq(ccnv(c0), c0), wal(s0, wal(s1, wb(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  3bitr4g(wcel(c0, crels), wceq(ccnv(c0), c0), wal(s0, wal(s1, wb(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wa(wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wss(c0, ccnv(c0))), wa(wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))))))
  anbi12d(wcel(c0, crels), wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))))
  a1i(wcel(c0, crels), wb(wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))))
  cnvsym(s0, s1, c0)
  bitrd(wcel(c0, crels), wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), ccnv(c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), ccnv(c0), cv(s0))))))
  syl5rbbr(wcel(c0, crels), wss(c0, ccnv(c0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), ccnv(c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), ccnv(c0), cv(s0))))), wss(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), ccnv(c0)))
  cnvsym(s0, s1, ccnv(c0))
  sseq1d(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), ccnv(c0), c0, wcel(c0, crels))
  sylib(wcel(c0, crels), wceq(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c0), wrel(c0))
  dfrel2(c0)
  2albidv(s0, s1, wcel(c0, crels), wi(wbr(cv(s0), ccnv(c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), ccnv(c0), cv(s0))), wi(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))
  imbi12d(wcel(c0, crels), wbr(cv(s0), ccnv(c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), ccnv(c0), cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, crels), wb(wbr(cv(s0), ccnv(c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))), wrel(c0))
  relbrcnvg(c0, cv(s0), cv(s1))
  syl(wcel(c0, crels), wb(wbr(cv(s1), ccnv(c0), cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))), wrel(c0))
  elrelsrelim(c0)
  relbrcnvg(c0, cv(s1), cv(s0))
  eqss(ccnv(c0), c0)
  2albiim(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))
  diff.ccnv.s(s0, c0)
  diff.ccnv.s(s1, c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, crels)
  diff.crels.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, crels)
  diff.crels.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elrelscnveq2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Rels →(`' c0 = c0 ↔ ∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s0[c0]s1 ↔ s1[c0]s0)))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  3bitr4g(c0 ∈ Rels, `' c0 = c0, ∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s0[c0]s1 ↔ s1[c0]s0))), (`' c0 ⊆ c0 ∧ c0 ⊆ `' c0), (∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s0[c0]s1 → s1[c0]s0)))∧ ∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s1[c0]s0 → s0[c0]s1)))))
  anbi12d(c0 ∈ Rels, `' c0 ⊆ c0, c0 ⊆ `' c0, ∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s0[c0]s1 → s1[c0]s0))), ∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s1[c0]s0 → s0[c0]s1))))
  a1i(c0 ∈ Rels, (`' c0 ⊆ c0 ↔ ∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s0[c0]s1 → s1[c0]s0)))))
  cnvsym(s0, s1, c0)
  bitrd(c0 ∈ Rels, c0 ⊆ `' c0, ∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s1[c0]s0 → s0[c0]s1))), ∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s0[`' c0]s1 → s1[`' c0]s0))))
  syl5rbbr(c0 ∈ Rels, c0 ⊆ `' c0, ∀(s0, ∀(s1,(s0[`' c0]s1 → s1[`' c0]s0))), `' `' c0 ⊆ `' c0)
  cnvsym(s0, s1, `' c0)
  sseq1d(`' `' c0, `' c0, c0, c0 ∈ Rels)
  sylib(c0 ∈ Rels, `' `' c0 = c0, Rel(c0))
  dfrel2(c0)
  2albidv(s0, s1, c0 ∈ Rels, (s0[`' c0]s1 → s1[`' c0]s0), (s1[c0]s0 → s0[c0]s1))
  imbi12d(c0 ∈ Rels, s0[`' c0]s1, s1[`' c0]s0, s1[c0]s0, s0[c0]s1)
  syl(c0 ∈ Rels, (s0[`' c0]s1 ↔ s1[c0]s0), Rel(c0))
  relbrcnvg(c0, s0, s1)
  syl(c0 ∈ Rels, (s1[`' c0]s0 ↔ s0[c0]s1), Rel(c0))
  elrelsrelim(c0)
  relbrcnvg(c0, s1, s0)
  eqss(`' c0, c0)
  2albiim(s0, s1, s0[c0]s1, s1[c0]s0)
  diff.ccnv.s(s0, c0)
  diff.ccnv.s(s1, c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, crels)
  diff.crels.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, crels)
  diff.crels.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: elrelscnveq4

blocks.name: cnvelrels
blocks.content: The converse of a set is an element of the class of relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 18-Aug-2019.)

blocks.name: cosselrels
blocks.content: Cosets of sets are elements of the relations class. Implies ` |- ( R e. Rels -> ,~ R e. Rels ) ` . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 25-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: cosscnvelrels
blocks.content: Cosets of converse sets are elements of the relations class. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 31-Aug-2021.)
